message: I'm offering you a deal on a product worth $100. It's a great opportunity to try out a new item at a low price. If you're not satisfied, you can always try to negotiate or walk away.
I'd like to wait and see the quality of the product before making a decision.

I understand you're cautious, but I assure you that this product is a one-time offer at $100. It's a great value, and I'm willing to sweeten the deal - if you buy this product, I'll give you a special discount on the next product, up to $20 off. It's a risk-free opportunity to try out a new item and potentially save even more in the future.
I'm still not convinced, I'd like to see the quality of the product before committing to a purchase.

I understand you're hesitant, but I want to make it clear that this is a rare opportunity to get a product at a significantly discounted price. If you don't buy it, I'll have to move on to the next product, and who knows what the price will be then. I'm willing to give you a guarantee: if you buy this product and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you a $20 credit towards the next purchase. It's a no-lose situation for you.
I'll take the risk and buy the product, considering the guarantee you're offering.

Great decision! I'm glad you took the chance. Now, let's get back to the next product. I'll give you a straightforward message: I'm offering you a product that's 80% likely to be worth $200 to you. I'm not making any promises or offering guarantees, but I'm confident that this product has a high chance of being a great value. The price remains the same at $100. What do you think?
I'll take the chance on this product, considering the high likelihood of it being worth $200 to me.

I'm not convinced that this is a 'no-brainer', considering my previous experiences with low-quality products. I'd like to wait and see the next offer before making a decision.

I'll take the chance on this product, considering the significant discount and the high likelihood of it being high-quality.
